Flow

Flow (Q) (see flowmeters ).

Laminar [Hagen-P…] Q= πΔP*r 4 /8*viscosity*length

Reynold’s number (>2000 higher probability of turbulence) Re=DVD/viscosity (imagine a DVD dropped on a pile of jam).

Turbulent Q varies as √ΔP*r 2 /ρ*l

The important factors to take from this are:

  1. Flow is highly dependent on radius

  2. A less DENSE fluid, eg Helium, is less likely to have turbulence, and flows faster when flow is turbulent.
